member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.AgentManager.AgentMovement
member.summary:
Agent movement and camera control
Agent movement is controlled by setting specific After the control flags are set, An AgentUpdate is required to update the simulator of the specified flags This is most easily accomplished by setting one or more of the AgentMovement properties
Movement of an avatar is always based on a compass direction, for example AtPos will move the agent from West to East or forward on the X Axis, AtNeg will of course move agent from East to West or backward on the X Axis, LeftPos will be South to North or forward on the Y Axis The Z axis is Up, finer grained control of movements can be done using the Nudge properties

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.AssetManager.RequestImage(OpenMetaverse.UUID,OpenMetaverse.ImageType,System.Single,System.Int32,System.UInt32,OpenMetaverse.TextureDownloadCallback,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Request a texture asset from the simulator using the system to manage the requests and re-assemble the image from the packets received from the simulator
member.param: The of the texture asset to download
The of the texture asset. Use for most textures, or for baked layer texture assets

A float indicating the requested priority for the transfer. Higher priority values tell the simulator to prioritize the request before lower valued requests. An image already being transferred using the can have its priority changed by resending the request with the new priority value
Number of quality layers to discard. This controls the end marker of the data sent. Sending with value -1 combined with priority of 0 cancels an in-progress transfer.
member.remarks: A bug exists in the Linden Simulator where a -1 will occasionally be sent with a non-zero priority indicating an off-by-one error.
member.param: The packet number to begin the request at. A value of 0 begins the request from the start of the asset texture
The callback to fire when the image is retrieved. The callback will contain the result of the request and the texture asset data

If true, the callback will be fired for each chunk of the downloaded image. The callback asset parameter will contain all previously received chunks of the texture asset starting from the beginning of the request

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.AssetManager.RequestImage(OpenMetaverse.UUID,OpenMetaverse.TextureDownloadCallback)

member.summary: In the future this will specify whether a webpage is attached to this face

member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.Primitive.TextureEntry
member.summary: Represents all of the texturable faces for an object
member.remarks: Grid objects have infinite faces, with each face using the properties of the default face unless set otherwise. So if you have a TextureEntry with a default texture uuid of X, and face 18 has a texture UUID of Y, every face would be textured with X except for face 18 that uses Y. In practice however, primitives utilize a maximum of nine faces

member.summary: Constructor that takes a default texture UUID
member.param: Texture UUID to use as the default texture

member.summary: Constructor that takes a TextureEntryFace for the default face
member.param: Face to use as the default face

member.summary: Constructor that creates the TextureEntry class from a byte array
member.param: Byte array containing the TextureEntry field
Starting position of the TextureEntry field in the byte array
Length of the TextureEntry field, in bytes

member.returns: A TextureEntryFace containing all the properties for that face

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.StartClassifiedSearch(System.String)
member.summary:
Query the data server for a list of classified ads containing the specified string. Defaults to searching for classified placed in any category, and includes PG, Adult and Mature results.
Responses are sent 16 per response packet, there is no way to know how many results a query reply will contain however assuming the reply packets arrived ordered, a response with less than 16 entries would indicate all results have been received
The event is raised when a response is received from the simulator
member.param: A string containing a list of keywords to search for
member.returns: A UUID to correlate the results when the event is raised

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.StartClassifiedSearch(System.String,OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.ClassifiedCategories,OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.ClassifiedQueryFlags)
member.summary:
Query the data server for a list of classified ads which contain specified keywords (Overload)
The event is raised when a response is received from the simulator
member.param: A string containing a list of keywords to search for
The category to search
A set of flags which can be ORed to modify query options such as classified maturity rating.
member.returns: A UUID to correlate the results when the event is raised
member.example:
Search classified ads containing the key words "foo" and "bar" in the "Any" category that are either PG or Mature
UUID searchID = StartClassifiedSearch("foo bar", ClassifiedCategories.Any, ClassifiedQueryFlags.PG | ClassifiedQueryFlags.Mature);
member.remarks: Responses are sent 16 at a time, there is no way to know how many results a query reply will contain however assuming the reply packets arrived ordered, a response with less than 16 entries would indicate all results have been received

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.StartDirPlacesSearch(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Starts search for places (Overloaded)
The event is raised when a response is received from the simulator
member.param: Search text
Each request is limited to 100 places being returned. To get the first 100 result entries of a request use 0, from 100-199 use 1, 200-299 use 2, etc.
member.returns: A UUID to correlate the results when the event is raised

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.StartDirPlacesSearch(System.String,OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.DirFindFlags,OpenMetaverse.ParcelCategory,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Queries the dataserver for parcels of land which are flagged to be shown in search
The event is raised when a response is received from the simulator
member.param: A string containing a list of keywords to search for separated by a space character
A set of flags which can be ORed to modify query options such as classified maturity rating.
The category to search
Each request is limited to 100 places being returned. To get the first 100 result entries of a request use 0, from 100-199 use 1, 200-299 use 2, etc.
member.returns: A UUID to correlate the results when the event is raised
member.example:
Search places containing the key words "foo" and "bar" in the "Any" category that are either PG or Adult
UUID searchID = StartDirPlacesSearch("foo bar", DirFindFlags.DwellSort | DirFindFlags.IncludePG | DirFindFlags.IncludeAdult, ParcelCategory.Any, 0);
member.remarks: Additional information on the results can be obtained by using the ParcelManager.InfoRequest method

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.StartLandSearch(OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.SearchTypeFlags)
member.summary:
Starts a search for land sales using the directory
The event is raised when a response is received from the simulator
member.param: What type of land to search for. Auction, estate, mainland, "first land", etc
member.remarks: The OnDirLandReply event handler must be registered before calling this function. There is no way to determine how many results will be returned, or how many times the callback will be fired other than you won't get more than 100 total parcels from each query.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.StartLandSearch(OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.SearchTypeFlags,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Starts a search for land sales using the directory
The event is raised when a response is received from the simulator
member.param: What type of land to search for. Auction, estate, mainland, "first land", etc
Maximum price to search for
Maximum area to search for
Each request is limited to 100 parcels being returned. To get the first 100 parcels of a request use 0, from 100-199 use 1, 200-299 use 2, etc.
member.remarks: The OnDirLandReply event handler must be registered before calling this function. There is no way to determine how many results will be returned, or how many times the callback will be fired other than you won't get more than 100 total parcels from each query.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.StartLandSearch(OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.DirFindFlags,OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.SearchTypeFlags,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Send a request to the data server for land sales listings
member.param:
Flags sent to specify query options
Available flags: Specify the parcel rating with one or more of the following: IncludePG IncludeMature IncludeAdult
Specify the field to pre sort the results with ONLY ONE of the following: PerMeterSort NameSort AreaSort PricesSort
Specify the order the results are returned in, if not specified the results are pre sorted in a Descending Order SortAsc
Specify additional filters to limit the results with one or both of the following: LimitByPrice LimitByArea
Flags can be combined by separating them with the | (pipe) character
Additional details can be found in
What type of land to search for. Auction, Estate or Mainland
Maximum price to search for when the DirFindFlags.LimitByPrice flag is specified in findFlags
Maximum area to search for when the DirFindFlags.LimitByArea flag is specified in findFlags
Each request is limited to 100 parcels being returned. To get the first 100 parcels of a request use 0, from 100-199 use 100, 200-299 use 200, etc.

remarks.para:
The event will be raised with the response from the simulator
There is no way to determine how many results will be returned, or how many times the callback will be fired other than you won't get more than 100 total parcels from each reply.
Any land set for sale to either anybody or specific to the connected agent will be included in the results if the land is included in the query

example.code: // request all mainland, any maturity rating that is larger than 512 sq.m StartLandSearch(DirFindFlags.SortAsc | DirFindFlags.PerMeterSort | DirFindFlags.LimitByArea | DirFindFlags.IncludePG | DirFindFlags.IncludeMature | DirFindFlags.IncludeAdult, SearchTypeFlags.Mainland, 0, 512, 0);

member.summary: Search All Events with specifid searchText in all categories, includes PG, Mature and Adult
member.param: A string containing a list of keywords to search for separated by a space character

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.StartEventsSearch(System.String,OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.DirFindFlags,System.String,System.UInt32,OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.EventCategories)
member.summary: Search Events
member.param: A string containing a list of keywords to search for separated by a space character

One or more of the following flags: DateEvents, IncludePG, IncludeMature, IncludeAdult from the Enum
Multiple flags can be combined by separating the flags with the | (pipe) character
"u" for in-progress and upcoming events, -or- number of days since/until event is scheduled For example "0" = Today, "1" = tomorrow, "2" = following day, "-1" = yesterday, etc.
Each request is limited to 100 entries being returned. To get the first group of entries of a request use 0, from 100-199 use 100, 200-299 use 200, etc.
EventCategory event is listed under.
member.returns: UUID of query to correlate results in callback.

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.DirFindFlags.DwellSort

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.DirFindFlags.SortAsc
member.summary: Specifies the query should pre sort the results in an ascending order when searching the land sales database. This flag is only used when searching the land sales database

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.DirFindFlags.PricesSort

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.DirFindFlags.PerMeterSort

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.DirFindFlags.LimitByPrice

member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.DirectoryManager.PlacesSearchData
member.summary:
Parcel information returned from a request
Represents one of the following: A parcel of land on the grid that has its Show In Search flag set A parcel of land owned by the agent making the request A parcel of land owned by a group the agent making the request is a member of
In a request for Group Land, the First record will contain an empty record
Note: This is not the same as searching the land for sale data source

member.summary: Convert a variable length field (byte array) to a string, with a field name prepended to each line of the output
member.remarks: If the byte array has unprintable characters in it, a hex dump will be written instead

The byte array to convert to a string
A field name to prepend to each line of output

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.Helpers.ZeroDecode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decode a zerocoded byte array, used to decompress packets marked with the zerocoded flag
member.remarks: Any time a zero is encountered, the next byte is a count of how many zeroes to expand. One zero is encoded with 0x00 0x01, two zeroes is 0x00 0x02, three zeroes is 0x00 0x03, etc. The first four bytes are copied directly to the output buffer.
member.param: The byte array to decode
The length of the byte array to decode. This would be the length of the packet up to (but not including) any appended ACKs
The output byte array to decode to
member.returns: The length of the output buffer

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.Helpers.ZeroEncode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encode a byte array with zerocoding. Used to compress packets marked with the zerocoded flag. Any zeroes in the array are compressed down to a single zero byte followed by a count of how many zeroes to expand out. A single zero becomes 0x00 0x01, two zeroes becomes 0x00 0x02, three zeroes becomes 0x00 0x03, etc. The first four bytes are copied directly to the output buffer.
member.param: The byte array to encode
The length of the byte array to encode
The output byte array to encode to
member.returns: The length of the output buffer

member.summary: The InternalDictionary class is used through the library for storing key/value pairs. It is intended to be a replacement for the generic Dictionary class and should be used in its place. member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.Inventory
member.summary: Responsible for maintaining inventory structure. Inventory constructs nodes and manages node children as is necessary to maintain a coherant hirarchy. Other classes should not manipulate or create InventoryNodes explicitly. When A node's parent changes (when a folder is moved, for example) simply pass Inventory the updated InventoryFolder and it will make the appropriate changes to its internal representation.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.Inventory.UpdateNodeFor(OpenMetaverse.InventoryBase)
member.summary:
Updates the state of the InventoryNode and inventory data structure that is responsible for the InventoryObject. If the item was previously not added to inventory, it adds the item, and updates structure accordingly. If it was, it updates the InventoryNode, changing the parent node if item.parentUUID does not match node.Parent.Data.UUID.
You can not set the inventory root folder using this method
member.param: The InventoryObject to store

member.summary: By using the bracket operator on this class, the program can get the InventoryObject designated by the specified uuid. If the value for the corresponding UUID is null, the call is equivelant to a call to RemoveNodeFor(this[uuid]). If the value is non-null, it is equivelant to a call to UpdateNodeFor(value), the uuid parameter is ignored.

member.returns: The InventoryObject corresponding to uuid.

member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.NetworkManager
member.summary: Login Routines

NetworkManager is responsible for managing the network layer of OpenMetaverse. It tracks all the server connections, serializes outgoing traffic and deserializes incoming traffic, and provides instances of delegates for network-related events.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.ObjectManager.AddPrim(OpenMetaverse.Simulator,OpenMetaverse.Primitive.ConstructionData,OpenMetaverse.UUID,OpenMetaverse.Vector3,OpenMetaverse.Vector3,OpenMetaverse.Quaternion)
member.summary: Create (rez) a new prim object in a simulator
member.param: A reference to the object to place the object in
Data describing the prim object to rez
Group ID that this prim will be set to, or UUID.Zero if you do not want the object to be associated with a specific group
An approximation of the position at which to rez the prim
Scale vector to size this prim
Rotation quaternion to rotate this prim
member.remarks: Due to the way client prim rezzing is done on the server, the requested position for an object is only close to where the prim actually ends up. If you desire exact placement you'll need to follow up by moving the object after it has been created. This function will not set textures, light and flexible data, or other extended primitive properties

member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.PacketBufferPool
member.summary: Object pool for packet buffers. This is used to allocate memory for all incoming and outgoing packets, and zerocoding buffers for those packets

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the ObjectPoolBase class. Initialize MUST be called after using this constructor.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the ObjectPool Base class.
member.param: The object pool is composed of segments, which are allocated whenever the size of the pool is exceeded. The number of items in a segment should be large enough that allocating a new segmeng is a rare thing. For example, on a server that will have 10k people logged in at once, the receive buffer object pool should have segment sizes of at least 1000 byte arrays per segment.
The minimun number of segments that may exist.
Perform a full GC.Collect whenever a segment is allocated, and then again after allocation to compact the heap.
The frequency which segments are checked to see if they're eligible for cleanup.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.ForceCleanup
member.summary: Forces the segment cleanup algorithm to be run. This method is intended primarly for use from the Unit Test libraries.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.GetObjectInstance
member.summary: Responsible for allocate 1 instance of an object that will be stored in a segment.
member.returns: An instance of whatever objec the pool is pooling.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.CheckIn(OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolSegment{`0},`0)
member.summary: Checks in an instance of T owned by the object pool. This method is only intended to be called by the WrappedObject class.
member.param: The segment from which the instance is checked out.
The instance of T to check back into the segment.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.CheckOut
member.summary: Checks an instance of T from the pool. If the pool is not sufficient to allow the checkout, a new segment is created.
member.returns: A WrappedObject around the instance of T. To check the instance back into the segment, be sureto dispose the WrappedObject when finished.

member.name: P:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.TotalSegments
member.summary: The total number of segments created. Intended to be used by the Unit Tests.

member.name: P:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.ItemsPerSegment
member.summary: The number of items that are in a segment. Items in a segment are all allocated at the same time, and are hopefully close to each other in the managed heap.

member.name: P:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.MinimumSegmentCount
member.summary: The minimum number of segments. When segments are reclaimed, this number of segments will always be left alone. These segments are allocated at startup.

member.name: P:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.MinimumSegmentAgePriorToCleanup
member.summary: The age a segment must be before it's eligible for cleanup. This is used to prevent thrash, and typical values are in the 5 minute range.

member.name: P:OpenMetaverse.ObjectPoolBase`1.CleanupFrequencyMilliseconds
member.summary: The frequence which the cleanup thread runs. This is typically expected to be in the 5 minute range.

member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.ParcelOverlayType
member.summary: Parcel overlay type. This is used primarily for highlighting and coloring which is why it is a single integer instead of a set of flags
member.remarks: These values seem to be poorly thought out. The first three bits represent a single value, not flags. For example Auction (0x05) is not a combination of OwnedByOther (0x01) and ForSale(0x04). However, the BorderWest and BorderSouth values are bit flags that get attached to the value stored in the first three bits. Bits four, five, and six are unused

member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.Settings
member.summary: Class for controlling various system settings.
member.remarks: Some values are readonly because they affect things that happen when the GridClient object is initialized, so changing them at runtime won't do any good. Non-readonly values may affect things that happen at login or dynamically

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.AGNI_LOGIN_SERVER
member.summary: Main grid login server

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ADITI_LOGIN_SERVER
member.summary: Beta grid login server

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ENABLE_INVENTORY_STORE
member.summary: InventoryManager requests inventory information on login, GridClient initializes an Inventory store for main inventory.

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ENABLE_LIBRARY_STORE
member.summary: InventoryManager requests library information on login, GridClient initializes an Inventory store for the library.

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.PING_INTERVAL
member.summary: Number of milliseconds between sending pings to each sim

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.DEFAULT_AGENT_UPDATE_INTERVAL
member.summary: Number of milliseconds between sending camera updates

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.INTERPOLATION_INTERVAL
member.summary: Number of milliseconds between updating the current positions of moving, non-accelerating and non-colliding objects

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.NETWORK_TICK_INTERVAL
member.summary: Millisecond interval between ticks, where all ACKs are sent out and the age of unACKed packets is checked

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.PACKET_INBOX_SIZE
member.summary: The initial size of the packet inbox, where packets are stored before processing

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.MAX_PACKET_SIZE
member.summary: Maximum size of packet that we want to send over the wire

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.MAX_SEQUENCE
member.summary: The maximum value of a packet sequence number before it rolls over back to one

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.RESOURCE_DIR
member.summary: The relative directory where external resources are kept

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.LOGIN_SERVER
member.summary: Login server to connect to

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.BIND_ADDR
member.summary: IP Address the client will bind to

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.USE_LLSD_LOGIN
member.summary: Use XML-RPC Login or LLSD Login, default is XML-RPC Login

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.MAX_HTTP_CONNECTIONS
member.summary: Maximum number of HTTP connections to open to a particular endpoint.
member.remarks: An endpoint is defined as a commbination of network address and port. This is used for Caps. This is a static variable which applies to all instances.

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.HTTP_INVENTORY
member.summary: Use Caps for fetching inventory where available

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.TRANSFER_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Number of milliseconds before an asset transfer will time out

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.TELEPORT_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Number of milliseconds before a teleport attempt will time out

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.LOGOUT_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Number of milliseconds before NetworkManager.Logout() will time out

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.CAPS_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Number of milliseconds before a CAPS call will time out
member.remarks: Setting this too low will cause web requests time out and possibly retry repeatedly

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.LOGIN_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Number of milliseconds for xml-rpc to timeout

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.RESEND_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Milliseconds before a packet is assumed lost and resent

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.SIMULATOR_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Milliseconds without receiving a packet before the connection to a simulator is assumed lost

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.MAP_REQUEST_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Milliseconds to wait for a simulator info request through the grid interface

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.PACKET_ARCHIVE_SIZE
member.summary: The maximum size of the sequence number archive, used to check for resent and/or duplicate packets

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.MAX_PENDING_ACKS
member.summary: Maximum number of queued ACKs to be sent before SendAcks() is forced

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.STATS_QUEUE_SIZE
member.summary: Network stats queue length (seconds)

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.CACHE_PRIMITIVES
member.summary: Primitives will be reused when falling in/out of interest list (and shared between clients) prims returning to interest list do not need re-requested Helps also in not re-requesting prim.Properties for code that checks for a Properties == null per client

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.POOL_PARCEL_DATA
member.summary: Pool parcel data between clients (saves on requesting multiple times when all clients may need it)

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.SIMULATOR_POOL_TIMEOUT
member.summary: How long to preserve cached data when no client is connected to a simulator The reason for setting it to something like 2 minutes is in case a client is running back and forth between region edges or a sim is comming and going

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.STORE_LAND_PATCHES
member.summary: Enable/disable storing terrain heightmaps in the TerrainManager

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.SEND_AGENT_UPDATES
member.summary: Enable/disable sending periodic camera updates

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.SEND_AGENT_APPEARANCE
member.summary: Enable/disable automatically setting agent appearance at login and after sim crossing

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.SEND_AGENT_THROTTLE
member.summary: Enable/disable automatically setting the bandwidth throttle after connecting to each simulator
member.remarks: The default throttle uses the equivalent of the maximum bandwidth setting in the official client. If you do not set a throttle your connection will by default be throttled well below the minimum values and you may experience connection problems

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.SEND_PINGS
member.summary: Enable/disable the sending of pings to monitor lag and packet loss

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.MULTIPLE_SIMS
member.summary: Should we connect to multiple sims? This will allow viewing in to neighboring simulators and sim crossings (Experimental)

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ALWAYS_DECODE_OBJECTS
member.summary: If true, all object update packets will be decoded in to native objects. If false, only updates for our own agent will be decoded. Registering an event handler will force objects for that type to always be decoded. If this is disabled the object tracking will have missing or partial prim and avatar information

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ALWAYS_REQUEST_OBJECTS
member.summary: If true, when a cached object check is received from the server the full object info will automatically be requested

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ENABLE_CAPS
member.summary: Whether to establish connections to HTTP capabilities servers for simulators

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ENABLE_SIMSTATS
member.summary: Whether to decode sim stats

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.LOG_ALL_CAPS_ERRORS
member.summary: The capabilities servers are currently designed to periodically return a 502 error which signals for the client to re-establish a connection. Set this to true to log those 502 errors

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.FETCH_MISSING_INVENTORY
member.summary: If true, any reference received for a folder or item the library is not aware of will automatically be fetched

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.DISABLE_AGENT_UPDATE_DUPLICATE_CHECK
member.summary: If true, and SEND_AGENT_UPDATES is true, AgentUpdate packets will continuously be sent out to give the bot smoother movement and autopiloting

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.AVATAR_TRACKING
member.summary: If true, currently visible avatars will be stored in dictionaries inside Simulator.ObjectAvatars. If false, a new Avatar or Primitive object will be created each time an object update packet is received

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.OBJECT_TRACKING
member.summary: If true, currently visible avatars will be stored in dictionaries inside Simulator.ObjectPrimitives. If false, a new Avatar or Primitive object will be created each time an object update packet is received

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.USE_INTERPOLATION_TIMER
member.summary: If true, position and velocity will periodically be interpolated (extrapolated, technically) for objects and avatars that are being tracked by the library. This is necessary to increase the accuracy of speed and position estimates for simulated objects

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.TRACK_UTILIZATION
member.summary: If true, utilization statistics will be tracked. There is a minor penalty in CPU time for enabling this option.

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.PARCEL_TRACKING
member.summary: If true, parcel details will be stored in the Simulator.Parcels dictionary as they are received

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ALWAYS_REQUEST_PARCEL_ACL
member.summary: If true, an incoming parcel properties reply will automatically send a request for the parcel access list

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ALWAYS_REQUEST_PARCEL_DWELL
member.summary: if true, an incoming parcel properties reply will automatically send a request for the traffic count.

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.USE_ASSET_CACHE
member.summary: If true, images, and other assets downloaded from the server will be cached in a local directory

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ASSET_CACHE_DIR
member.summary: Path to store cached texture data

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.ASSET_CACHE_MAX_SIZE
member.summary: Maximum size cached files are allowed to take on disk (bytes)

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.DEFAULT_EFFECT_COLOR
member.summary: Default color used for viewer particle effects

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.MAX_RESEND_COUNT
member.summary: Maximum number of times to resend a failed packet

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.THROTTLE_OUTGOING_PACKETS
member.summary: Throttle outgoing packet rate

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.CLIENT_IDENTIFICATION_TAG
member.summary: UUID of a texture used by some viewers to indentify type of client used

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.USE_HTTP_TEXTURES
member.summary: Download textures using GetTexture capability when available

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.MAX_CONCURRENT_TEXTURE_DOWNLOADS
member.summary: The maximum number of concurrent texture downloads allowed
member.remarks: Increasing this number will not necessarily increase texture retrieval times due to simulator throttles

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.PIPELINE_REFRESH_INTERVAL
member.summary: The Refresh timer inteval is used to set the delay between checks for stalled texture downloads
member.remarks: This is a static variable which applies to all instances

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.PIPELINE_REQUEST_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Textures taking longer than this value will be flagged as timed out and removed from the pipeline

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.LOG_LEVEL
member.summary:
Get or set the minimum log level to output to the console by default
If the library is not compiled with DEBUG defined and this level is set to DEBUG You will get no output on the console. This behavior can be overriden by creating a logger configuration file for log4net

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.LOG_NAMES
member.summary: Attach avatar names to log messages

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.LOG_RESENDS
member.summary: Log packet retransmission info

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.Settings.LOG_DISKCACHE
member.summary: Log disk cache misses and other info

member.summary: Flight is disabled (not currently enforced by the sim)

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.RegionFlags.AllowParcelChanges

member.summary: The initial state given to a request. Requests in this state are waiting for an available slot in the pipeline

member.summary: A request that has been added to the pipeline and the request packet has been sent to the simulator

member.summary: A request that has received one or more packets back from the simulator

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.TextureRequestState.Finished
member.summary: A request that has received all packets back from the simulator

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.TextureRequestState.Timeout
member.summary: A request that has taken longer than to download OR the initial packet containing the packet information was never received

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.TextureRequestState.Aborted
member.summary: The texture request was aborted by request of the agent

member.name: F:OpenMetaverse.TextureRequestState.NotFound
member.summary: The simulator replied to the request that it was not able to find the requested texture

member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.TextureDownloadCallback
member.summary: A callback fired to indicate the status or final state of the requested texture. For progressive downloads this will fire each time new asset data is returned from the simulator.
member.param: The indicating either Progress for textures not fully downloaded, or the final result of the request after it has been processed through the TexturePipeline

The object containing the Assets ID, raw data and other information. For progressive rendering the will contain the data from the beginning of the file. For failed, aborted and timed out requests it will contain an empty byte array.

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.TexturePipeline.RequestTexture(OpenMetaverse.UUID,OpenMetaverse.ImageType,System.Single,System.Int32,System.UInt32,OpenMetaverse.TextureDownloadCallback,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Request a texture asset from the simulator using the system to manage the requests and re-assemble the image from the packets received from the simulator
member.param: The of the texture asset to download
The of the texture asset. Use for most textures, or for baked layer texture assets

A float indicating the requested priority for the transfer. Higher priority values tell the simulator to prioritize the request before lower valued requests. An image already being transferred using the can have its priority changed by resending the request with the new priority value
Number of quality layers to discard. This controls the end marker of the data sent
The packet number to begin the request at. A value of 0 begins the request from the start of the asset texture
The callback to fire when the image is retrieved. The callback will contain the result of the request and the texture asset data

If true, the callback will be fired for each chunk of the downloaded image. The callback asset parameter will contain all previously received chunks of the texture asset starting from the beginning of the request

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.TexturePipeline.RequestImage(OpenMetaverse.UUID,OpenMetaverse.ImageType,System.Single,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sends the actual request packet to the simulator
member.param: The image to download
Type of the image to download, either a baked avatar texture or a normal texture
Priority level of the download. Default is 1,013,000.0f
Number of quality layers to discard. This controls the end marker of the data sent
Packet number to start the download at. This controls the start marker of the data sent
member.remarks: Sending a priority of 0 and a discardlevel of -1 aborts download

member.name: T:OpenMetaverse.Messages.Linden.ChatterBoxSessionAgentListUpdatesMessage
member.summary:
Sent from the simulator to the viewer.
When an agent initially joins a session the AgentUpdatesBlock object will contain a list of session members including a boolean indicating they can use voice chat in this session, a boolean indicating they are allowed to moderate this session, and lastly a string which indicates another agent is entering the session with the Transition set to "ENTER"
During the session lifetime updates on individuals are sent. During the update the booleans sent during the initial join are excluded with the exception of the Transition field. This indicates a new user entering or exiting the session with the string "ENTER" or "LEAVE" respectively.

member.param: An containing the data

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.Voice.VoiceGateway.AccountLogin(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This is used to login a specific user account(s). It may only be called after Connector initialization has completed successfully
member.param: Handle returned from successful Connector create request
User's account name
User's account password
Values may be AutoAnswer or VerifyAnswer

This is an integer that specifies how often the daemon will send participant property events while in a channel. If this is not set the default will be on state change, which means that the events will be sent when the participant starts talking, stops talking, is muted, is unmuted. The valid values are: 0 Never 5 10 times per second 10 5 times per second 50 1 time per second 100 on participant state change (this is the default)
false

member.name: M:OpenMetaverse.Voice.VoiceGateway.SessionCreate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Create a Session Sessions typically represent a connection to a media session with one or more participants. This is used to generate an outbound call to another user or channel. The specifics depend on the media types involved. A session handle is required to control the local user functions within the session (or remote users if the current account has rights to do so). Currently creating a session automatically connects to the audio media, there is no need to call Session.Connect at this time, this is reserved for future use.
member.param: Handle returned from successful Connector create request
This is the URI of the terminating point of the session (ie who/what is being called)
This is the display name of the entity being called (user or channel)
Only needs to be supplied when the target URI is password protected

This indicates the format of the password as passed in. This can either be ClearText or SHA1UserName. If this element does not exist, it is assumed to be ClearText. If it is SHA1UserName, the password as passed in is the SHA1 hash of the password and username concatenated together, then base64 encoded, with the final = character stripped off.
